Join Our Classes

Choose from a variety of class types below which suit your needs. You'll find our all our classes are mixed ability, both genders and age groups.

Type of Classes

Group Pilates

classes take place in one of our bright and airy exercise studios. All you need is a mat which we provide and yourself. There is occasional use of a resistance band, straps or ball, but that's down to the instructor and they'll always be provided. We will will direct and coordinate you through exercises that incorporate upper and lower body strength, as well as core activation.

One to One

Individual 1:1 sessions to address any issues you’d like to work on.Private classes are ideal if you are coming to Pilates for rehab purposes, have a specific goal you are working towards, or want to complement your group classes to ensure you are on track.I have a full range of small equipment to use during your class as necessary, and you will receive a plan to practice at home to meet your needs and schedule if required.

Online Classes

Online Pilates classes are available for convenience and accessibility from the comfort of your home, when distance, time and circumstances are a consideration. Both group and private classes are available and are taught live on Zoom, not pre-recorded so that you can still benefit from individual guidance, feedback and variations that are appropriate for you on the day.

Chair Pilates

Chair Pilates stands out as a gentle yet incredibly effective form of exercise, tailored to individuals of all fitness levels and abilities. This low-impact exercise is ideal for seniors looking to improve strength, flexibility, and overall health. In this guide, we’ll explore the numerous benefits of Chair Pilates, provide step-by-step instructions for simple exercises, and offer modifications to tailor your workout to your individual needs.
